metadata.title: CVE-2022-32250 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
net/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c in the Linux kernel through 5.18.1 allows alocal user (able to create user/net namespaces) to escalate privileges toroot because an incorrect NFT_STATEFUL_EXPR check leads to ause-after-free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32250` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1047-dell300x - 4.15.0-1047.52
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1074-gke - 5.4.0-1074.79~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1046-gkeop - 5.4.0-1046.48~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1114-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1114.122
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1132-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1132.142
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-184.194').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-117.132~18.04.1').
